IntroSection.Title: We want to help our communities and learn more about COVID-19 infection patterns in the Boston area.
IntroSection.Text: TestBoston is a COVID-19 study supported by Brigham and Women's Hospital and the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard.
IntroSection.Full: Given the increase in infections due to the delta variant in the greater Boston area, please let us know if you would like another COVID-19

AboutSection.Title: About the Study
AboutSection.Text: Our goal is to watch the infection rate of COVID-19 in Massachusetts over time. Some communities have higher infection rates than others. Some people catch COVID-19 and don’t have symptoms. We hope our study will help us understand COVID-19 better, and benefit patients with and without COVID in the future.

Questions.Title: Questions we are trying to answer:
List: How common is COVID-19 in our communities?
How common it is to have COVID-19 without symptoms?
Do people become immune to COVID-19 after they have it?
How can researchers test many people while they are at home?

ResultsSection.Title: Results Dashboard
ResultsSection.Text: The interactive TestBoston Dashboard displays test results and study data across different time periods and demographics. Data is updated weekly.

FaqSection.Title: Frequently Asked Questions
FaqSection.Text: You can also call or email our study staff if you have questions about TestBoston:

Items.Question: What is the TestBoston Study?
Paragraphs: Our goal is to watch the infection rate of COVID-19 in Massachusetts over time. Some communities have higher infection rates than others. Some people catch COVID-19 and don’t have symptoms. We hope our study will help us understand COVID-19 better, and benefit patients with and without COVID in the future.

Items.Question: Can I still participate and get COVID-19 testing through this study?
Paragraphs: If you are enrolled already in the study, you may request a test kit if you are symptomatic, have had a known COVID-19 exposure, or would just like to have asymptomatic testing. In order to request a test kit, please sign-in to your TestBoston.org participant account and complete a “Feeling Sick Survey” or email us at info@testboston.org .

If you are not yet enrolled in the study, please fill in a brief screening survey here. We are currently fully enrolled but we will let you know if we are able to increase enrollment in the near future.

Items.Question: Can anybody join this study?
Paragraphs: Yes. TestBoston is open to all adults in the greater Boston area. To volunteer, please fill in a brief screening survey here. If you volunteer and are selected to participate, you will be emailed an invitation code to register.

Items.Question: Will I get a COVID-19 test if I join the study?
Paragraphs: Yes. If you received an invitation to join the study and you decide to enroll, you will be tested for COVID-19. However, enrollment space is limited and will be filled on a first-come, first served basis. If you enroll, you will receive a home-testing kit containing two tests within approximately one week of joining the study. The home test kit will contain a virology test kit (nasal swab) and an antibody test kit (finger prick), with instructions on how to collect and return your samples to our lab for testing. The nasal swab detects if you have active COVID-19. The finger prick tests if you have antibodies to COVID-19 (meaning that you had the virus in the past). If you also agree to join the longitudinal study, we will send you kits to repeat these tests every month for 5 additional months.

Items.Question: Will I receive my results?
Paragraphs: You will receive the research results of your viral test. These will be posted on your TestBoston.org dashboard every month within about 24-48 hours of your kit being sent back to us. You will not receive the results of your antibody test. Results will inform public health decision-making. When results are reported, they will be released as a data summary noting basic demographic information. Your identity will remain private.

Items.Question: Is TestBoston only for people experiencing COVID-19 symptoms?
Paragraphs: No - any adult resident of the greater Boston area is welcome to volunteer for the study, regardless of whether or not you are experiencing symptoms (or have ever experienced symptoms in the past).

Items.Question: Do I have to go anywhere to be in the study?
Paragraphs: No. TestBoston is a home-based study. Participants in TestBoston do not have to visit a clinic, hospital, or doctor’s office. Participants will answer a short survey online and receive COVID-19 sample collection kits at home, which are mailed back to our lab.

Items.Question: Will a doctor, nurse, or study staff visit my house to test me?
Paragraphs: No. You will receive a sample collection kit in the mail and independently complete a nasal swab and a finger prick blood test by yourself. If you have any questions, you may reach the study team at any time by phone or email.

Items.Question: Is it free to participate in TestBoston?
Paragraphs: Yes. There is no charge to participate in TestBoston. We will pay for the kit, shipping costs and monthly testing--none of these services will be billed to your insurance.

Items.Question: What will I have to do if I join the study?
Paragraphs: Participants in TestBoston are asked to fill out a short survey about COVID-19 and perform two simple COVID-19 sample collections on themselves at home. Participants are asked to return the kits to us in a pre-paid box for processing. Participants may also volunteer to repeat this process each month for 5 additional months. The test collections are a nasal swab and a finger prick blood spot.

Items.Question: Can my family join TestBoston?
Paragraphs: Anyone interested in joining the study is asked to fill in a brief screening survey here. Participants are randomly selected on an individual basis, which could mean that even if multiple family members from one household volunteer, only one person may be selected to participate.

Items.Question: Can I give my invitation code to someone else?
Paragraphs: No. Each invitation code should only be used by the person that the invitation letter is addressed to.

Items.Question: Who is running this study?
Paragraphs: TestBoston is a COVID-19 study supported by Brigham and Women's Hospital and the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard. The people leading the study are infectious disease doctors at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

The Broad Institute is a leading, academic research institute located in Cambridge. The Broad Institute performs thousands of daily COVID-19 tests for the Departments of Health throughout Massachusetts, as well as for various COVID-19 studies in Massachusetts.

TeamSection.Title: Our Team
TeamSection.Text: We are a team of infectious disease doctors and researchers who want to better understand how COVID-19 is affecting individuals and communities so we can better serve all patients.

PIs.Name: Ann E. Woolley, MD, MPH
PIs.Affiliations: Associate Physician, Infectious Diseases, Brigham and Women’s Hospital; Instructor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School
PIs.Info: Dr. Ann Woolley is the Associate Clinical Director for Solid Organ Transplant Infectious Diseases at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and a Clinical Investigator whose research focuses on expanding treatment and diagnostics.

PIs.Name: Lisa A. Cosimi, MD
PIs.Affiliations: Associate Physician, Brigham and Women’s Hospital; Assistant Professor, Harvard Medical School
PIs.Info: Dr. Cosimi is an associate physician at Brigham and Women’s Hospital, whose work in the divisions of Global Health Equity and Infectious Diseases focuses on strengthening health systems and the quality of healthcare in resource-limited settings.

PIs.Name: Deborah T. Hung, MD, PhD
PIs.Affiliations: Professor, Harvard Medical School; Core faculty member and Co-director, Infectious Disease and Microbiome Program, Broad Institute
PIs.Info: Dr. Deborah Hung is a physician scientist at the Broad Institute, Harvard Medical School and Massachusetts General Hospital who studies infectious diseases and is an attending physician in infectious diseases and pulmonary & critical care medicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

Others.Title: Administrative Team, Broad Institute
Members: Andrea Saltzman, Director, Office of Research Subject Protection
Sharon Wong, PhD, Associate Director - Infectious Disease and Microbiome Program

Others.Title: Engineering Team, Broad Institute
Members: Andrew Zimmer, Director, Data Donation Platform
Anna Hupalowska, Illustration & Data Visualization Designer
Jen Lapan, Principal Software Product Manager
Andrew Tang, Senior Interaction Designer, Pattern

Others.Title: Clinical Team, Brigham and Women’s Hospital
Members: Himaja Nagireddy, HSPH MS Candidate, Intern

Others.Title: Additional Partners
Members: Clinical Research Sequencing Platform (CRSP), Broad Institute

MailingSection.Title: TestBoston is currently enrolling invited patients of Brigham and Women’s Hospital.
MailingSection.Text: If you did not receive an invitation to join the study but are interested in staying up to date about general TestBoston information, please join our newsletter list:

PrequalPage.Title: First, confirm your eligibility

InvitationCode.Question: Enter your invitation code
InvitationCode.Tooltip: If you received a paper or email invitation from your doctor, it includes a 12-digit invitation code at the top.

Error.Part1: The code you entered isn’t active. Please check your code and try again. You can always contact the TestBoston study staff for help:
Error.Part3: If you have already enrolled, please click Sign In above to sign back in with your email address and password.
Error.Part4: We anticipate reaching current study capacity around 12/23/20. If your code does not work, it's possible the study has reached capacity for now and auto-prevented your enrollment. We apologize. You may email the study and include your invitation code if you think there has been an error.

Zip.Question: What is your current mailing zip code?
Zip.Error: We’re sorry. That zip code is outside the TestBoston study zone. Please check the zip code you entered and try again.

Step1.Title: Enter the subject’s 12-digit invitation code
Step1.Subtitle: If the code is unknown, access the Brigham link file and use the subject’s name to retrieve the code.

Step3.Title: Verbally confirm subject is 18 years or older before beginning enrollment.

Collect.Title: How to collect your samples
Collect.Text: It's important to take your test and send it back on the same day, Monday through Thursday. These are the days that the Broad Institute will process TestBoston samples.

Return.Title: How to return your samples
Return.Text: Your test samples must be returned via UPS on the same day you take your test. Drop your test kit at either an official UPS Store or in a UPS Drop Box. You can also request a UPS pick-up for your home if you have a safe place to leave your package outside for the UPS driver.

Text.Part2: Type your zip code and click on “See All Options”.

Step2.Title: Step 2:
Step2.Text: Under “Location Type”, check the boxes for “The UPS Store®” and “UPS Drop Box”. Then click the search icon

Text.Part1: You may be eligible for UPS home pickup if you can safely leave your package in a place where UPS drivers can access it. Schedule a pickup by calling
Text.Part2: If you have any difficulty returning your kit through UPS, please contact the study team

Text.Part1: If you have further questions, please reach out to study staff by emailing

SessionExpired.Text: You were away for a while, so we logged you out as a security precaution. Please log in again to return to the last page you were on.

SessionWillExpire.Title: Your session will time-out soon
SessionWillExpire.Text: To protect your privacy, the system is going to log you out because you have been away for a while. Click “Continue” to stay logged in. Click “Sign Out” if you are done for now.
SessionWillExpire.RenewalFailed: Session renewal failed. Please log out and log back in again.

Error.CannotVerify: Could not verify address, please double-check your address.
Error.UnknownVerifyError: An unknown error occurred while verifying address.
Error.InvalidHouseNumber: Street number could not be found
Error.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR: We're sorry, something went wrong. If the problem persists please contact us at support@easypost.com.
Error.NOT_ACCEPTABLE: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.
Error.NOT_FOUND: The requested resource could not be found.
Error.FORBIDDEN: Unable to access the requested resource.
Error.PAYMENT_REQUIRED: Insufficient funds. Please check your billing settings at http://www.easypost.com/account/billing.
Error.UNAUTHORIZED: Unable to access the requested resource, authorization failed.
Error.BAD_REQUEST: Malformed request. Please check the contents and retry.
Error.PAYMENT_GATEWAY.ERROR: The payment processor could not handle the request. Please try again or contact support@easypost.com if the problem persists.
Error.MODE.UNAUTHORIZED: This resource requires a production API Key to access.
Error.MODE.CONFLICT: API Key mode conflicted with parameter mode.
Error.DATE.PARSE.FAILURE: At least one date was formatted incorrectly and could not be parsed.
Error.PARAMETER.FORBIDDEN: The request could not be completed due to forbidden properties present in the parameters.
Error.ADDRESS.PARAMETERS.INVALID_CHARACTER: The parameters passed contained an invalid character.
Error.ADDRESS.PARAMETERS.INVALID: The parameters passed to create an Address were missing or invalid.
Error.ADDRESS.COUNTRY.INVALID: Invalid 'country', please provide a 2 character ISO country code.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFICATION.FAILURE: The address was unable to be verified.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.UNAVAILABLE: Address verification is not available. Please try again.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFICATION.INVALID: One of the verifications selected is invalid.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.CARRIER_INVALID: Unable to verify address using provided carrier.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.UPSTREAM_UNAVAILABLE: Address verification is not available due to an upstream service not responding. Please try again.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.ONLY_US: USPS can only validate US addresses.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.INTL_NOT_ENABLED: International Verification not enabled on this account. Please contact support@easypost.com.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.MISSING_STREET: Insufficient address data provided. A street must be provided.
Error.ADDRESS.VERIFY.MISSING_CITY_STATE_ZIP: Insufficient address data provided. A city and state or a zip must be provided.
Error.E.COUNTRY.UNSUPPORTED: This country is not supported in this mode. Try in production mode.
Error.E.ENGINE.UNAVAILABLE: No verification engine is available to service this country. Please try again later.
Error.E.QUERY.UNANSWERABLE: We can not provide enough data in this country to satisfy this request. Please try again later.
Error.E.ADDRESS.NOT_FOUND: We could not find the entered address.
Error.E.SECONDARY_INFORMATION.INVALID: Invalid secondary information(Apt/Suite#). Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.
Error.E.SECONDARY_INFORMATION.MISSING: Missing secondary information(Apt/Suite#). Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.
Error.E.HOUSE_NUMBER.INVALID: We could not find the street number provided.
Error.E.ADDRESS.MULTIPLE: Multiple addresses were returned with the same zip.
Error.E.TIME_ZONE.UNAVAILABLE: The time zone service is currently unavailable.
Error.E.PO_BOX.INTERNATIONAL: Cannot verify international PO Box. Please note, this can show up as an error on a successful request.
